title-group.article-title: INTRODUCTION: THEOLOGY OF CULTURE AS THEOLOGICAL HUMANISM

ref.mixed-citation: E.W. Said, Humanism and Democratic Criticism (New York, NY: Columbia UP, 2004).
W. Schweiker, Theological Ethics and Global Dynamics: In the Time of Many Worlds (Oxford: Blackwell, 2004)
T. Todorov, Imperfect Garden: The Legacy of Humanism, trans. C. Cosman (Princeton, NJ: Princeton UP, 2002).
Dalai Lama, Ethics for the New Millennium (New York, NY: Riverhead Books, 1999), p. 19.
J. Grondin, Introduction to Philosophical Hermeneutics, trans. J. Weinsheimer (New Haven, CT: Yale UP, pp. 32-9.
Gerhard Ebeling (p. 33).
J. Grondin, Sources of Hermeneutics (Albany, NY: State University of New York Press, 1995), pp. 99-110.
Grondin, Introduction to Philosophical Hermeneutics, p. 37.
R.P. Scharlemann's analysis of Schleiermacher's systematics in The Reason of Following: Christology and the Ecstatic I (Chicago, IL: Chicago UP, 1991), pp. 106-10.

D.E. Klemm, 'Schleiermacher on the Self: Immediate Self-Consciousness as Feel- ing and as Thinking' in D.E. Klemm and G. Zöller (eds), Figuring the Self: Subject, Absolute, and Others in Classical German Philosophy (Albany, NY: State University of New York Press, 1997), pp. 169-91.
F. Schleiermacher, The Christian Faith (1821/1830), H.R. Mackintosh and J.S. Stewart (eds) (Philadelphia, PA: 1976), #4, p. 12.

D.E. Klemm, 'Schleiermacher's Hermeneutic: The Sacred and the Profane' in J.F. Keuss (ed.), The Sacred and the Profane: Contem- porary Demands on Hermeneutics (Hants, England: Ashgate, 2003), Ch. 6, pp. 61— 76.

German essay is 'Über die Idee einer Theologie der Kultur', reprinted from Kant Studien in Religionsphilosophie der Kultur, zweiter entwürfe, hgs. G. Radburch and P. Tillich (Darmstadt: Wissenschaftliche Buchgesellschaft, 1958), pp. 29-52.
'On the Idea of a Theology of Culture' in What Is Religion?, trans. J.L. Adams (New York: Harper and Row, 1969), pp. 155-81.
P. Tillich, Theology of Culture, R.C. Kimball (ed.) (London/Oxford and New York: Oxford UP, 1959).
P. Tillich, 'Aspects of a Religious Analysis of Culture' in Theology of Culture, pp. 40-51.
'On the Idea of a Theology of Culture' in What Is Religion?, p. 165.
Ibid.
Scharlemann, 'Tillich and the Reli- gious Interpretation of Art' in J.L. Adams, W. Pauck and R.L. Shinn (eds), The Thought of Paul Tillich (San Francisco: Harper & Row, 1985), pp. 156-74, p. 165.
Scharlemann, 'Tillich and the Religious Interpretation of Art', p. 169.

L. Gilkey, 'The Religious Situation at the End of the Twentieth Century' in R.F. Bulman and F.J. Parrella (eds), Religion in the New Millennium: Theology in the Spirit of Paul Tillich (Mercer UP, 2001), pp. 7-18, pp. 16-17.
W. Schweiker, 'Reconsidering Greed' in W. Schweiker and C. Mathewes (eds), Having: Property and Possession in Religious and Social Life (Grand Rapids, MI: 2004), pp. 249-71.
D. Eck, Encountering God: A Spiritual Journey from Bozeman to Banares, 2 edn (Boston, MA: Beacon Press, 2003)
D. Eck, A New Religious America: How a 'Christian Country' Has Become the World's Most Religiously Diverse Nation (San Francisco, CA: HarperSanFrancisco, 2003).
Gilkey, 'The Religious Situation at the End of the Twentieth Century', p. 11.
M.E. Marty and R.S. Appleby (eds), Fundamentalism Reconsidered, The Funda- mentalism Project, vol. 5 (Chicago, IL: Chicago UP, 1995).
